alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Cherokee; Houston; Trinity (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 30 at 11:00AM CST until February 03 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Neches River At Rockland affecting Jasper, Angelina, Tyler and Polk Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Neches River Near Alto affecting Anderson, Trinity, Cherokee and Houston Counties. Neches River Near Diboll affecting Tyler, Angelina, Trinity, Houston and Polk Counties. For the Neches River...including Lake Palestine, Neches, Alto, Diboll, Rockland...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neches River near Alto. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Boat ramps and picnic areas near the river will begin to flood. Ranchers should move cattle and equipment near the river to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 16.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM CST Tuesday was 17.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Thursday afternoon and continue falling to 13.5 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.8 feet on 12/21/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1100 AM CST.
